block.p: The article ''How the Body Knows When to Gain or Lose'' strongly supports the notion that biology determines one's weight. The article draws upon a range of evidence ranging from animal to behavioral human studies indicating that weight is either controlled by biological factors or is highly resistant to change.

Still, it is widely acknowledged that obesity has sharply increased in recent years and that other countries including those in Europe and Asia have far fewer obese people than the United States does.
These facts suggest that biological factors do not tell the whole story, even as they suggest that lifestyle changes aimed at weight loss are futile.
Such accounts of the weight epidemic in this country are clearly unhelpful in that they undercut any motivation one may have to engage in a healthier lifestyle in an effort to lose weight.
